page.title: 15Carlisle United AFC
page.content: The "Blues" play at Brunton Park in the Second Division of the Canon League. This is a luxury since their average "gate" last season was just above 4,000. With no share of away "gates" and their most attractive "derby" fixture removed with Newcastle promoted to the First Division, United have to exist on a shoe string. For their game with fellow strugglers Shrewsbury, Carlisle had only 12 fit players, including the 40 year old manager "Pop" Robson, who was substit- ute. Carlisle lost 0-2 and slipped to bottom of the Division. The ground is well appointed with a modern Centre and Wing Grandstands. Few extra precautions had to be taken after the 1985 Bradford fire, though four surveillance cameras are to be installed with grant aid from the Football Ground Improvement Trust.
